main.sprites

Class Sprite

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.sprites.Sprite
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Aura, Brick, CoinTile, Fireball, FlagPole, Mario, MotionStageSprite, Powerface, PowerTile, SecretBlock, StageFloorBase, StarBrick

    public abstract class Sprite
extends java.lang.Object
    Name: Jaskaranbir Dhillon
    Date: Wednesday, April 21, 2016
    Class Description:

    The base class that must be inherited by every Sprite of game.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Sprite

        public Sprite(java.lang.String SVGData,
              float xPos,
              float yPos,
              float xVel,
              float yVel,
              javafx.scene.image.Image... sprites)
        Creates a single stationary sprite with given data. Intended for StageBlocks such as bricks, tiles etc.
        Parameters:
        SVGData - The SVG Collision Data of sprite.
        xPos - x-Position of Sprite.
        yPos - y-Position of Sprite.
        xVel - x-Velocity of Sprite.
        yVel - y-Velocity of SPrite.
        sprites - Images containing Sprite States

      • Sprite

        public Sprite(java.lang.String[] SVGData,
              float xPos,
              float yPos,
              float xVel,
              float yVel,
              javafx.scene.image.Image... sprites)
        Creates a single motion sprite with given data. Intended for moving sprites such as enemies, some powerups etc.
        Parameters:
        SVGData - The SVG Collision Data of sprite (should be of form top, right, bottom, left, collision box, anything else.
        xPos - x-Position of Sprite.
        yPos - y-Position of Sprite.
        xVel - x-Velocity of Sprite.
        yVel - y-Velocity of SPrite.
        sprites - Images containing Sprite States

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public abstract void update()
        The method which executes sprite logic. Called in GameLoop (but exceptions can be made, such as being called from logic of another sprite class).

      • updatePosition

        public void updatePosition()
        Updates position of Sprite on stage. Needs to be called manually in sprite logic (the update method. Will cause NullPointerException if sprite is motion sprite. Motion Sprites must implement their own logic for position updates. See MotionStageSprite class for implementation for MotionSprites.

      • getPlayerStates

        public java.util.List<javafx.scene.image.Image> getPlayerStates()
        Returns:
        ArrayList containing sprite states.

      • getSpriteFrame

        public javafx.scene.image.ImageView getSpriteFrame()
        Returns:
        ImageView containing sprite image on stage.

      • getSpriteBounds

        public javafx.scene.shape.SVGPath getSpriteBounds()
        Returns:
        SVGPath collision data of stationary sprite. Returns null if sprite is a motion sprite.

      • getSpriteBoundsArray

        public javafx.scene.shape.SVGPath[] getSpriteBoundsArray()
        Returns:
        SVGPath collision data array of motion sprite. Returns null if sprite is a stationary sprite.

      • getxPos

        public float getxPos()
        Returns:
        x-Position of Sprite

      • getyPos

        public float getyPos()
        Returns:
        y-Position of Sprite

      • getxVel

        public float getxVel()
        Returns:
        x-Velocity of Sprite

      • getyVel

        public float getyVel()
        Returns:
        y-Velocity of Sprite
